topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54fe9e586368725ff6c10900#post_54fe9e586368725ff6c10900
[bq="Whatevs"]"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54fe9d046368723262480600#post_54fe9d046368723262480600
>profound
There is that word again.
People tell me bioware is profound. Then I spurn their suggestions forever from that point on.
Point is Squiggs, you don't want what's in muh braiiiin!  [/bq]
I'm going to be the oddball out and say that STALKER is the most profound in the whole "struggling in a wasteland environment" category.  I liked fallout 3 cause at the time it was something new to the point that for a decade it defined post-apocalyptic survival genre, *BUT* the reason why I didn't like new vegas was that at the time of release it wasn't worth the price.  What I mean is that when NV originally costed $60 instead of $10 it lacked enough new things to truly make it worthwhile; it was a good game and all, but $60 for a game that is on the back-end pretty much the same just with new guns, rebalance and that?  Nuh-uh.  At $10 it's a hell of a game.

Tl:dr; it's a game that you buy later on cause it ages well, but not at release.



Why do I love STALKER more?  Cause even though they're all extremely low budget games they have about the same number of potential gameplay hours (assuming you're playing both games on hard mode; as in around 30 hours for fallout 3 & nv for hard mode and 30 hours for stalker)

"Oh well stalker has reused maps"
Only four of the maps are reused; your main hub, chernobyl, red forest and I forget the other.
"Well fallout is cheaper now"
Stalker has always been a cheap game; the reason why the games are $40 for the three games is because the people that made the game even though the studio got shutdown due to lack of funding still want to make a Stalker 2 and eventually we'll get a stalker 2 whereas bethesda is a AAA studio therefore they automatically have money.  If a game is good then I don't mind the higher price.
Also no DLC.

Also the moral topic of stalker is actually really good; it's just subtle and doesn't club your face in with the moral topic.

Tl:dr of everything; if you want wasteland survival then play STALKER.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
